question:
Which of the following are examples of the null set?
(i) Set of even prime numbers greater than 2
(ii) Set of odd natural numbers divisible by 2
(iii) $\{x : x \text{ is a natural number, } 5 < x < 6\}$
(iv) $\{x : x \text{ is a point common to two concentric circles}\}$
solutionSteps: (i) 2 is the only even prime. Primes > 2 are odd. Null set.
(ii) Odd numbers are not divisible by 2. Null set.
(iii) No natural number between 5 and 6. Null set.
(iv) Concentric circles do not intersect. Null set.

question:
Which of the following sets are finite or infinite?
(i) The set of days of a week
(ii) $\{x : x \in N, x > 1000\}$
(iii) The set of solutions of $x^2 - 1 = 0$
(iv) The set of points on a line segment
(v) The set of prime numbers less than 100
solutionSteps: (iv) Infinite points exist on a line segment. Infinite.

question:
State whether each of the following set is finite or infinite:
(i) The set of lines passing through a given point
(ii) The set of vowels in the English alphabet
(iii) The set of multiples of 7
(iv) The set of leaves on a specific tree
(v) The set of circles with a fixed radius $r$
solutionSteps: (i) Infinite lines can pass through a point. Infinite.

question:
In the following, state whether A = B or not:
(i) $A = \{1, 2, 3\}; B = \{3, 1, 2\}$
(ii) $A = \{a, b\}; B = \{a, a, b, b, b\}$
(iii) $A = \{x : x \text{ is a multiple of } 10\}; B = \{10, 15, 20, 25, ...\}$
(iv) $A = \{x : x^2 = 4, x \in Z\}; B = \{2, -2\}$
solutionSteps: (ii) Repetition doesn't change set. A = B.
(iii) 15 is in B but not A. $A \neq B$.

question:
Are the following pair of sets equal? Give reasons.
(i) $A = \{1, 2\}, B = \{x : x \text{ is solution of } x^2 - 3x + 2 = 0\}$
(ii) $A = \{x : x \text{ is a letter in the word ALLOY}\}$; $B = \{y : y \text{ is a letter in the word LOYAL}\}$
solutionSteps: (ii) $A = \{A, L, O, Y\}$. $B = \{L, O, Y, A\}$. Elements are same. A = B.

question:
From the sets given below, select equal sets:
$A = \{1, 2, 3\}, B = \{1, 2\}, C = \{3, 1, 2\}, D = \{1, 2, 3, 4\}$
$E = \{1, 2, 1\}, F = \{1, 2, 3\}, G = \{1, 2, 3, 3\}, H = \{4, 3, 2, 1\}$
solutionSteps: Equal sets: A = C = F = G, B = E, D = H.
finalAnswer: A = C = F = G, B = E, D = H
